intro: Daviesia filipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hop萧, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility, and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
